abstract: Five-acre flight deck of American nuclear-powered aircraft carrier Roosevelt is bustling as troops work quickly to get fighter jets on six-hour round trip flights to provide cover for Iraqi ground troops fighting Islamic State for control of besieged city Ramadi; American military is working hand in hand with Iraqi forces, but speed and effectiveness of high-tech effort is hampered by lack of modern equipment and communications tools on ground.
lead_paragraph: No matter how advanced, American aircraft can go only as fast as their less experienced, much slower partners on the ground: the Iraqi security forces.

headline.main: U.S. Jets Meet Limit as Iraqi Ground Fight Against ISIS Plods On
headline.print_headline: High-Tech Air Battle Against ISIS Is Slowed by Low-Tech Ground Fight

snippet: No matter how advanced, American aircraft can go only as fast as their less experienced, much slower partners on the ground: the Iraqi security forces.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
